Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Carrie B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on our first trip to Amsterdam. Hotel is very close to the Apollolann Tram stop (use the 24) and the staff was extremely helpful for us firs timers. Our room was very spacious and overlooked a courtyard area on the backside of the hotel. It was great to wake up in the morning hearing the birds singing. (We didn't hear any noises from other guests) The breakfast wasn't as extensive as some hotels offer, but was still good. The beds weren't in the best shape, but the rest of our room/bathroom seemed freshly renovated. They provide free wireless and it works very well (unlike some other hotels where it is spotty). Can't say enough about the staff and location. As a group of women traveling, we liked the fact that the hotel was in a quieter part of the city, yet only a 15 minute Tram ride to the Red Light District and Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel... Medium quality beds”
Reviews.Author: Bladimiros S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel lmis located in a increadible convinence, close to the airport as it is to the downtown. But the Beds are in rough shape. The breakfast is very good and the people is very friendly. For a one night stay before flight is good.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Matthew A Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was my first time visiting amsterdam so i wasnt very familiar with where everything in the city was. The hotel staff were very nice and the basic room was great for two people. It is very close to all of the museums which are just a close walk away. I went to amstetdam for the nightlife though which was a little far away to get to the main places like dam square. We found ourself taking cabs alot which were very expensive. This hotel is great if you want to be in a quieter part of the city and close to the museums. Next time, i think personally i would just put what we spent on cabs towards getting a hotel in the heart of the city. The location is really the only negative i have about this place though and is more my fault than anything for not researching better. All in all it was a great experience and the staff was extremely helpful for first timers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay cannot fault”
Reviews.Author: 3petals
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 13 year old daughter for 3 nights from 12-15 April. I got a very good deal via Otel.com & breakfast was included. After reading some of the reviews I was a little apprehensive but I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel was really easy to find, I found if we caught the 24 tram this was quicker and took about 15-20 mins from the centre. It was very close to shops restaurants and museums. Our room was excellent and huge, the beds were comfy and we had a brand new bathroom everything was very, very clean. The only gripe I have is the pillow was not good but I think that is a continental thing!!! The breakfast room was lovely, ok so there was no bacon and eggs but I knew this anyway as I know they don't eat this in Holland. Coffee was good and hot and there was a great coffee machine. All in all I cannot fault my stay here and would book here almost certainly again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accomodation”
Reviews.Author: mmhaboh
Reviews.Content: This hotel offer a good standard. It is poor in some details but in Amsterdam can be considered a good compromise beteween price and service. Breakfast is extremely poor. Rooms are not well isolated (you can hear guests snoring... imagine if more happens!) It is in a calm residential areas with several restaurant. Close to the teathers and Museum area (Museaum's square). It is very well connected with center and train station on one side and WTC, Hospital, Free University on the other, using few trams like n5 and n.24. It is very close to South-Station, closer to Schipol airport. I think it is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Quiet Area”
Reviews.Author: Accountess
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Oct 6-9 of this year and thought it was a nice hotel for the price. It is your typical European room, not as large as we are perhaps used to in North America, but certainly big enough for our needs. The bathroom was very clean and obviously newly renovated, and the room was very clean as well. We always used the stairs (except for luggage in and out), so the complaints by some about the elevator didn't apply to us. The breakfast was adequate for our needs and staff were very helpful, though sometimes a bit hard to find... We absolutely loved the location - it was out of the city centre on a very quiet street so we always had a good night's sleep. It was just steps from the tram, which was very convenient, and only about 10-15 minutes from downtown attractions.

Reviews.Title: “poor quality, questionable service, not clean”
Reviews.Author: jpcz
Reviews.Content: Positives: quiet location, 15 min nice walk to RAI conference center, people at the front desk are nice coffee and tea in lobby at any time and you can get wine, coca etc- if you ask for it- at any time Negatives: Haha, this is NOT a 4 star hotel ! Minimal customer care - seems to be the management style from the above One bathroom smelled really badly - refused Rooms are cold, because the heating panels have air inside AND they do not turn the heat on (it is under 10 C outside) - even after we have asked for it... There is no thermostat in the room ! Bathroom is tiny, beds are not comfortable with tough blankets and pillows. I would avoid this place again, although I am not that picky. I just expect hotel to be a clean, pleasant, reasonably warm place to spend a night on a conference trip. :(

Reviews.Title: “good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: geepee
Reviews.Content: stayed 7/8/9th October. Chose the hotel as we did not want to be in the heart of Amsterdam as we like a quiet life in the evenings ! and the price was a lot cheaper. Two minutes walk to the tram stop, numbers 5 and 24 run into the centre and passed most of the other attractions so so easy to use. You can buy a 1hr ticket [2.60 euro] or a 24hr [7 euro] from the driver or hotel reception. We purchased a 72 hour ticket (15 euro each] this we purchased from the tourist information office at the Leidseplein. All you do is scan the card as you get on any tram and scan as you get off. The hotel reception will give you a tram map. The stops are shown clearly on electronic screens in the tram and are told to you in English as well so getting lost is very difficult !! The hotel itself is very comfortable and clean we had room 249 which looked as if it had been refurbished, the bathroom was very small but had a lovely hot shower. We had twin beds which are very comfortable and the hotel is very quiet through the night, so always got a good nights sleep. My only complaint with the room was the towels, they are so thin and the bath towels are to small. Breakfast was ok, a few pastries, and better quality juice would of been nice, there was a limited selection of cold meats, cheese, two cereals, bread, rolls, preserves, boiled eggs, yoghurt. not a great selection but enough to start the day off. Just around the corner is Beethoven straat a road with some nice varied shops including a small supermarket, delis, off licence, bakery, chocolate shop e.t.c, also an eetcafe, the Felicio which was a nice bar/cafe, we had a meal in Calzone a pizzeria, it was ok but not worth the money which was different to De Barone, the nearest restaurant to the hotel, the food here was lovely along with the service and ambiance. One place we would recommend you visit is the area known as Jordan, and if you go on a Saturday there is a great market, Noordermarkt, great food stalls and various other stalls. If you like the beer and fancy a trip to a small brewery to taste the beer and get a tour then take the trams 10 [get off at Hoogte Kadijk walk 100yds to the bridge and you will see the windmill the brewery is at the back of the windmill] or 14[ get off at Pontanusstraat) which arrives on the other side of the river to the 10 but again walk over the bridge to the windmill. Great snacks can be purchased to have with your beer, try a mixed plate of sausage and cheese mmmmmmm ! hope this helps graeme

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Mildew, Uncomfortable beds!!”
Reviews.Author: Imaglobaltrotter
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week. This is NOT a 4 star hotel. The property is poorly maintained, bathrooms are filled with mildew, the bed linens and sheets smell unpleasant and dont seem clean, carpet in the room is full of stains, a bulb did not work in the room and they didnt fix it until the night before I left. The only good thing I can say about the hotel was that there was a good free breakfast that came with my booking. The staff was friendly but like I said, they didnt fix the bulb in the room until the night before I left. The neighborhood, location and breakfast are the only good things about this hotel. I would never stay at this hotel again. For the price I paid, I could have stayed somewhere much much better.

Reviews.Title: “No frills but clean enough”
Reviews.Author: spadgeHuddersfield
Reviews.Content: Room was spacious enough but telly was rubbish, bar was the same price as any city bar but without a doubt you could find cheaper Typical price was 5 Euro / pint. Breakfast again was nothing to write about- just the usual ham & cheese! It is situated near to the tram line for dam square & central station, take the number 24 or number 5. Trams where 2.60 Euros = 1 hours travel. Hotel in general was average with no real nasty points.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Deborah050
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights 16/17 September. Room was clean but no tea or coffee making facilities in room. Curtains had a huge gap and spent two nights with a shaft of light in my eyes! Staff were very uncooperative and no bar as the only member of staff was on the desk. As we were a party of 37 this was very poor. Knowing well in advance that the hotel would be full they should have put on more staff o cope with demand at breakfast - one two slice toaster for 37 people is not enough. Many rooms had no working phones, hairdryers, lights and certainly no internet (even though it was advertised). I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, excellent quiet location, would certainly stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: invicta10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as two couples for 4 nights at the end of August. We liked the excellent location, in a quiet and pleasant neighbourhood away from the city centre. Access to the main cultural attractions and to the city centre, however, is easy by tram which stops about 150 meters away. With one exception we found the staff generally pleasant and helpful. We liked the attractive breakfast room, but though the breakfasts were adequate we thought it pretty woeful for a 4-star hotel to serve orange squash instead of orange juice and to have tinned fruit cocktail instead of fresh fruit salad. Also, a little more variety in the breakfast offer would have been nice. We liked the fact that complimentary tea and coffee were available in the bar area 24/7 - nice to relax there after a heavy day's sightseeing and mull over what we had visited. Lovely rooms, well furnished and with good ensuite facilities though some might find the layout of the rooms and the bathrooms a bit cramped. Over all we were pleased with the hotel and would certainly stay there again. If you plan on arriving by car be aware that though there is on street parking in the streets around the hotel, leaving your car there for the duration of your stay would be a very expensive option. Drop off your luggage at the hotel then park your car in the Park and Ride by the Olympic Stadium. A bargain at 8 Euros for each 24 hour period and your ticket includes the tram to and from the hotel. Final tip, for shopping or sightseeing, use public transport and buy a pass for as many days as you will be in the city. If you plan on doing a lot of museums and galleries, consider buying the Amsterdam Card which includes the pass for travel by all forms of public transport and free entry to all the museums as well as an inclusive canal tour.

Reviews.Title: “Ok value for money, calm district”
Reviews.Author: akl7622
Reviews.Content: Near tram and a small, nice shopping area. The hotel and staff is nice and informal, exept for a very rude woman in the breakfast room. OK standard, although there is need of some renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Not very nice rooms, very nice poeple”
Reviews.Author: FredInParis
Reviews.Content: I had the room 438, and where waked up by the elevator noise.... The room was really small and dark. But the room was clean. The Hotel is old but clean and well situated (near the tram 5 direct to central station), on a nice avenue. People in the Hotel are really friendship, speak English.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Quality”
Reviews.Author: 10trip_10_10
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed stay in amasterdam but hotel is sub standard. Found 4 flying beatles in hotel room. The shower didn't work and and staff didn't weren't responsive to resolving the issue, left having to take bath for 2 days. No tea/coffee facilities in the room, very dated and not clean. High cost for a 4 star hotel. Great city but don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, residential area south of town near a tram line.”
Reviews.Author: DHW49
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because it was relatively inexpensive and likely to be in a quiet neighborhood. It met our expectations; the breakfast was fine and the street was quiet. Apollolaan is actually one of the streets used for outdoor display of sculpture was was worth a visit on its own! Very near tram lines 5 and 24 and some decent restaurants nearby as well. The hotel was nothing special -- it did not have air conditioning for the two very warm days we spent there (above 30 Celsius), but reasonably pleasant. The staff was helpful but did fail to warn us of the brief tram strike that made sightseeing difficult one day (announced in advance on the trams - but we don't read Dutch!). The hotel was close enough to the key museums that a 20 minute walk took us there and the trams resumed mid-day, so no major fallout from the non-central location, and it was nice to leave the bustle behind at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Good but beware of the hidden tax”
Reviews.Author: AtriBit
Reviews.Content: As other posters have said this hotel is in a quiet area but very close to a tram line that takes you to the city centre or to Amsterdam Zuid WTC train station, from which itÂ´s 6 min to the airport. I think itÂ´s a 3 star hotel in terms of room amenities and breakfast. The first room they offered us on arrival was next to the kitchen, on the ground floor - when we said we didnÂ´t like it they moved us to the 2nd floor. No complaints except that the special rate (3 nights for the price of 2) on the Best Western web page didnÂ´t include the city tax - not too much (15 euros for 3 nights) but be aware of this!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, quiet little hotel”
Reviews.Author: cdjen
Reviews.Content: A beautiful and quiet residential district. A block from 2 tram lines that bring you to downtown within 20 minutes and the museums are 10 minutes away by tram.... A nice comfortable ride and one can enjoy the scenery. The tram 1,2 or 3 day tickets give you the liberty of hop- on/off with the same price, a service that we do not get in America .... too bad! Our room 374 is spacious enough with a 3 pane window and has a king size bed (in Europe these beds are usually 2 singles side by side) with a narrow but long balcony giving on a treed garden thus very quiet even with the door opened. I highly recommend this room.A Pleasant breakfast from almost hard boiled eggs ( I asked for some 3 min. eggs and they obliged me and the young lady refused a tip.), cold meats, cold cereals etc..... An automatic coffee/hot water machine is there 24/7 with ginger biscuits also and apples. Wireless in the room. Parking is expensive ( 21.50 euro/day and free from 7 P.M. till 9 A.M., otherwise 3 euros/h). The canal tours are a must... 6-8 euros/person for 1 to 1.5h. Amazing to see people of all ages using the bike but as a pedestrian, beware of the bike!!!! They come from every directions even directions you have never thought off and fast. Bathroom has no counter which is a nuisance when you are there for 3-4 days otherwise,a very good size for an European bathroom. Electrical plugs are hard to reach save one by the main door which is not handy for the desk. One "tiny" elevator large enough for 3 persons or only one with luggage. C'est l'Europe of course!!!! A bit pricey for an hotel that is not right in the center of town but and does not offer free parking. if you can have a discount ... I suggest you take: it is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not all rooms are 4star quality”
Reviews.Author: asmalyk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three days and were given a single room that was clearly not of 4 star quality. Simple, dated and partially worn furniture, small, simple bathroom, no tub. In my opinion a solid 2star room. After complaining to the front desk, they immediately switched me to a better room without much discussion. The hotel staff is clearly aware that at least some of their rooms do not satisfy a 4star category. The new room was much better, but still with old and partially worn furniture. The breakfast buffet is also simple and not of 4 star quality.

Reviews.Title: “Totally awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: KatieGinNC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a pure gem. Designed by a famous local architect, previously a private residence. Quaint enough to be a B & B, but offering great amenities. Great value, great rooms, great staff, did I say great? The Delphi is a little off the beaten path, but in a wonderful neighborhood of in-town chateaus (The Pijp), very convenient to the tram service (50 yards from hotel), but a wonderful walk to Museumplien and Leidseplien. Great restaurants just around the corner. A very clean and quiet neighborhood. The free breakfast was not a full service affair, but much more than just a continental breakfast. Free internet that worked great. The staff is freindly and accomodating. I'd stay here anytime!

Reviews.Title: “A good quality, friendly hotel in a quieter part of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: RichWestSussex
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good quality hotel away from the noise of the city this is a good option. The hotel had a tram line 1 min walk from the front door and you can get into the city center very easily this way. The room was comfortable and clean and a good size. The staff we met were very welcoming and friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The breakfast was plentiful and adequate and the coffee ok! It is also close to the museum area and opera house. All in all a good stay and gives you a chance to see a very upmarket part of the city nearby with plenty of lovely cafes and restaurants within a few minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and away from the noise of the city...”
Reviews.Author: fleapit
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in this comfortable and cosy hotel. The room/bed was just right and the breakast all you needed. The staff efficient and courteous. The quiet area just 10 to 15 minutes on a tram from the city centre is green and you can walk to the Vondel Park and on into the city. The quiet location is important as a new metro system is being built and there is a lot of noise and disruption in many city centre streets! The location also meant that we saw other, more local but no less interesting, parts of the city. It is also easily reached from the airport by public transport with just one change. Overall excellent and heartily recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but not too far away from the fun!”
Reviews.Author: Gooood1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, located just a short walk from the museum qtr, with a tram stop a stones throw from the hotel. Every night we got a perfect nights sleep in spacious room, nothing fancy but ideal for city break, would def recommend it. Amsterdam is a great place to visit for any age, with something for everyone, loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 4cruises_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Amsterdam last month to embark on a wonderful Northern European cruise. We only had one day in Amsterdam before boarding our cruise but we had the time of our lives!!! Our plane landed in Amsterdam early in the morning, and we were extremely happy when we arrived at this lovely hotel just after 9:00 AM and we were told that our room was ready for check in. We were also offered to help ourselves to breakfast which was free of charge and the food was very satisfying, The entire staff were very friendly, our room was very comfortable and we were able to catch some ZZZ's before we ventured out into this amazing city. After a full day of sightseeing we returned to the hotel to find a nice local restaurant for dinner. We were advised to try a nearby Italian restaurant named Baronyâ€™s and we were not disappointed. My husband had the best lasagne he has ever tasted! and this restaurant was also very reasonably priced. Our night ended with a couple of glasses of wine at the Delphi which included conversation of the friendly hotel staff. I have the fondest memories of this hotel and Amsterdam in general. I hope to have an opportunity to visit again someday!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service & Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: lostinbc
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the very nice neighborhood that this quaint and quiet hotel is located in, excellent service, good breakfast, rooms are dated with no A/C in ours, but we enjoyed the staff who went above and beyond assisting us at every turn! I felt I did a lot of research before we made our reservation, and after staying at the Hilton down the road previous to the Delphi, for the rate it was money well spent!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location in excellent area”
Reviews.Author: Mactravels78
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in the Delphi and found it an excellent value for money. In the Beethovenstrasse area the hotel is 2 minutes from the tram and has several good restaurants nearby. Th area is slightly out of the city center in an excellent residential area. It was a 10 minute walk to the Van Gogh Museum. The hotel is in a 100 year old building converted to an hotel 40 years ago. It has been regularly upgraded and is comfortable and everything works. The guests were primarily Dutch business folk who clearly knew a good value.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special indeed”
Reviews.Author: matsmithy
Reviews.Content: One of the hidden secrets of Amsterdam - how did three stars hotel manage to get four stars???? Delphi is honest three star hotel, 40 minutes walk from the city center. Narrow stairs, modest and quite ugly rooms with garbage view, continental breakfast (10 euro) - nothing special . Good for older couples.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay at the Best Western Delphi”
Reviews.Author: SRIRAM_05
Reviews.Content: I had a very good time at Best Western Delphi for the very short time I was there in Amsterdam. The location is fantastic especially if you want to be away from the hustle bustle of the City. The surroundings are very serene with the river flowing very near by with a lot of greenary around. Although the hotel is a bit far from the Main City of Amsterdam, public transportation from the Hotel is a just a stone's throw away. Also the musuem district is a couple of KMs away and is easily walkable. The staff was nice and very polite. They help in getting me a cab to the Airport in no time. The use of free Internet was an added bonus. The room was fine and clean and so was the entire hotel. The only negative was the elevator and this is the common complaint with many European Hotels. All in all, it is a very nice hotel and a great value for money in an expensive city like Amsterdam. Had a very good time and would like to take my Wife with me sometime soon to this very Hotel. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - minimalist breakfast - find a free Wifi hotspot”
Reviews.Author: TigerTimUK
Reviews.Content: At a conference across the road at Hilton (â‚¬350) so â‚¬80 great value. Single rooms small but clean, quiet Breakfast is very minimalistic continental rolls cheese ham etc Best find was that around the hotel there are lots of free Wifi points but too weak to access inside hotel. So .... Take your iPod Touch go out of hotel turn left go about 20 yards and sit on nice seat outside opticians and use one of the 3 open Wifi spots I found !! Also found canals bounced wifi signal around excellently so always could get a great free wifi signal from any bridge !!

Reviews.Title: “Don't know how they got 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: tomer_NL
Reviews.Content: It's a 4 star hotel, the location is great but there are a lot of 4-5 hotels in the area. I choose it according to the photos they put on the websites, and the photos here on TripAdvisor. The Room was very small, and looked nothing like the picture. there was no bath, only a shower - and very small one. The chair was broken. I asked to change rooms, the front desk was unfriendly about it. as I used the soap in the room, I wasn't able to change rooms anymore for that night (as there was no one to clean after me), even not for a surcharge. As he was alone in the hotel - he couldn't help with any problem outside his post, so he couldn't get me another chair. The hair blower didn't work as well. On the second day I could change rooms (had to pay 33% surcharge, but thats fine...). The executive room was well equipped and nicely furnished, the bathroom was very nice also (this is the room they have on their site). The phone didn't work well though... Breakfast was nice, don't expect vegetables or scrambled eggs, there is also nobody in sight - one should go to reception. All in all - not a good experience, I don't recommend it...

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied. Will stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: DR_RocketScientist
Reviews.Content: I was in Amsterdam for a conference. The Delphi was a pleasant 15 minute walk from the RAI conference center. My wife accompanied me and hooked up with several other wives from the conference. We had a recently refurbished room on the second (European) floor with a shared balcony facing the courtyard. We saw up to four ringed parakeets at a time visiting a feeder at the apartment next door. We arrived at 9 AM and were given a room immediately. We were even treated to breakfast when we arrived. The breakfast room doubles as a bar for guests in the evenings, although is not used much. Just ask the desk clerk for drinks and he/she will take care of it. One night two fellows walked in the door and asked for drinks. The clerk asked if they were guests and they said yes. Then he requested their room numbers which they gave. He pointed out that the hotel had no rooms with those numbers and asked them to leave. We slept most evenings with the windows open, closing them at 7AM when the early flights began arriving at Schiphol. The room was clean, housekeeping was efficient, and staff was helpful and friendly. Breakfast was good, but unvarying over the nine mornings we were there. There are several good restaurants (mostly Italian) and shops on Bethovenstraat. However, I highly recommend La Falote, a little neighborhood restaurant run by Chef Peter Linden in the opposite direction. Walk past the tram stop and follow the main street until it comes to a T. Cross to the right and it is about 1/2 block on the right, about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. (Making a left at the T takes you to the museums). There is a Dag (daily) Menu for 10 euros. Chef Linden is young and very gregarious, hauling out his accordion both nights we visited. He also discourages smoking. Good, solid food with a local flavor. One negative comment. I discovered that the room safe was not fastened to anything. Maintenance did not get around to correcting the matter during my visit. We liked this hotel and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a quiet area.”
Reviews.Author: oenoluvr
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Delphi and and found it to be a great accomadation for our needs. The room was ample in size, the breakfasts sufficient and it was only a 2 minute walk to a tram stop that took us right into the city center (10-15 minutes). The hotel is outside of the city center in a very quiet neighborhood. From the hotel you could easily walk to the museum area. The people that work here are very friendly and helpful. We arrived at the hotel at 8am after a red-eye from L.A. and were, of course, exhausted. The receptionist told us that the room was not quite ready and offered us breakfast while we waited about about an hour for our room. As soon as the room was ready we were notified and we were in our room by 9am. In the area there are a couple of small stores and restaurants if you are not in the mood to deal with the city. A little warning for those individuals who are not interested only in the red light district and the "coffeeshops!" Many of the museums and other sights are closed or have restricted access because of renovations until 2009. Thought we had plenty to do for the 4 days we were there, we were disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “a very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: GÃ©raldine
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days in Amsterdam at the Delphi Hotel. It was very pleasant. The room is nice and clean, the furniture is basic and cosy : thick curtains, smooth carpet. the bathroom is quite small but it's OK : a shower in a corner, toilets on the other side. The shower is closed with a curtain which would be ok if it would stop getting stuck to your body when it's wet and the water invade all the bathroom floor, I thought it was strange considering the standard of the hotel. The beakfast is nice and local (bread, jam, ham...). The hotel is located in a quiet and residential area (the rich one in fact), the street is very quiet and the tram stop is only at a 2-minute walk from the hotel, you reach the city center in 10 minutes. the hotel is conviently located to visit the Rijkmuseum and the van Gogh Museum, you can reach them by foot. At night you cannot find a restaurant, you have to go to the city center to eat french fries and pizzas and hamburgers...., if you want vegetable, you'll have to pay 25 â‚¬ pp in a steak house (plenty of them everywhere). Considering the rate, it's good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Witch25
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Amsterdam yesterday. We stayed at the Delphi Hotel and I have to say that I could not fault the hotel in anyway. The room was spotless, it was extremely clean. The breakfast was typical continental breakfast with plenty of supplies of everything. The service was excellent the staff were very helpful. We arrived 2 hours early for check in and were able to check in and we were able to store our luggage at the hotel before we left for the airport after checking out. The staff were great. The location is perfect. Just away from all the noise and crowds but a tram ride away from all the sights. The trams run all the time so you are never waiting for a tram and a taxi home late at night is between â‚¬10-â‚¬15. All in all excellent. Amsterdam is great.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: lisaduh
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and stayed in the city center for 2 nights before coming to this hotel. I loved it! The trams as you will read are close by so easy and inexpensive to get to all sites. We had an interior room that overlooked a quiet courtyard. Staff was excellent. Requested a taxi for following morning and it was actually early. It is in a residential neighborhood which was so nice and peaceful. About a block away are several restaurants, markets and shops. I will recommend this hotel for clients. No it doesn't have all the amenities of a large hotel but it is very comfortable. Highly recommend unless you are looking for a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Served us well, could be better”
Reviews.Author: Jordanuk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a residential area of Amsterdam and the local neighbourhood is lovely. Trams number 5 and 24 leave frequently to get into the bustling centre, and are only a minutes walk from the hotel. It was nice to be able to come back after a day out to a peaceful area. Apparently the hotel has gone through a long refurbishment, and I requested rooms in part of the hotel that had been finished. There were 6 of us in my party, and we booked 2 doubles and 1 twin. All our rooms were on the fourth floor. The twin room was the largest out of the three. The hotel is advertised as a four star, but I did not feel the double rooms were of a four star quality. They were both pretty small, and the bathroom was tiny. Our shower leaked quite badly, and there was not much leg room at all if you needed to sit down to use the toilet - knees were touching the wall!! As we really only used the hotel to sleep, this did not really bother us as the staff were friendly and the hotel was clean and tidy. Breakfast is typically Dutch serving only continental food. Morning rolls, toast, cereals, yoghurts, cheese, ham, boiled eggs. Good selection. No tea or coffee facilities in the room, but you can order complimentary tea and coffee at any time and it is brought to your room which I thought was a nice touch. Plenty of English speaking channels on the television and room cleaned to a good standard each day. All in all a good stay and yes, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “worked well”
Reviews.Author: TheJGuy
Reviews.Content: Just back from three nights at the Delphi. (03/05) Great rate in a quiet area of South Amsterdam. Good Breakfast, friendly staff, and near the 5 & 24 Tram Lines. 15 min walk to the Museums. Had a rather large bright corner room which worked well for us.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place”
Reviews.Author: jlhc99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late February for 2 nights and found that for the price you pay (approx 100 Euros per night incl tax and continental breakfast), it is a decent choice. The rooms are a bit outdated in terms of decor and furnishings and if you travel in the colder months....be warned of the poorly insulated window sills and minimal control over the heat. In addition, our room was on the 2nd floor. One morning, I ventured up to the 3rd floor and noticed that it had most definetely been remodeled with newer carpeting and wallpaper. I asked the front desk about this and was advised that the hotel is undergoing a slow renovation (I assume so as not to disturb the guests). Bottom line, if you stay here, ask for a room on the 3rd floor or above. On another few notes, the hotel only offers a basic but good breakfast in the morning and other than that, has no restaurant. There is however, a great Italian trattoria called Dal Barone, just around the corner and down one block on the right. Great food and decent prices! In addition, for people not familiar with the layout of Amsterdam, this hotel is not located in the heart of the city, but rather about a 15 minute tram ride from Dam Square and 20 or so from the Central Station. It is in the Old South section of Amsterdam and in a beautiful upscale neighborhood of tree lined streets. Much preferred over the packed city center and some rather seedy areas!!! You can also walk from the hotel to the Museumplein (Rembrandt and Van Gogh Museums) and the Concertgebouw with relative ease.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent bargain!”
Reviews.Author: whateverintexas
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying four nights at the Hotel Delphi, and I highly rec. it! I got an amazing deal online from the Best Western website (52 euros/night including breakfast) and it was great! The hotel is in a very nice, upscale part of Amsterdam, only a few minutes walk to the 5 and 24 tram lines. This will get you to the Leidseplein in 5-10 minutes. I have always stayed near the Leidseplein before, but i will go to the Delphi again. The room was large and very clean; there is a lift so that you can get your luggage upstairs without breaking your back on those famous A'dam staircases, the staff are extremely friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was a GREAT way to start the day--they offer coffee, tea, milk, juice, cheeses, meats, yogurt, fruit, boiled eggs, several kinds of breads, jams, chocolate spreads, honey, butter, cereals--it's a great deal! The only main disappointment I had was that the site said there was wireless internet available--yes, that's true, but it costs 22 euros plus tax for 12 hours! forget it! the guy at the hotel agreed, and he pointed me to the internet cafe :) my bed was comfy, though, there was a sofa in my room, which had tall ceilings and big windows that overlooked a courtyard. i also had a shared balcony, satelite tx, a shower and tub, and a nice desk. yay for the hotel delphi! :)

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and safe place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Delphi is in a quiet part of the city. There is a beautiful park area adjacent. It is just a short walk to a scenic canal. There is a convenient tram stop just a short walk away. The room was larger than most I have experienced when I have stayed in Amsterdam. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The breakfast was very nice each morning.The adventure of riding to the old part of the city each day by tram was a highlight of the trip. This is a very good, quiet place to stay in a beautiful city.

HotelInfo.Name: Best Western Delphi Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Apollolaan 101-105, Amsterdam 1077 AN, The Netherlands
